definition: in a difficult situation/to cut a sorry figure/scoundrel! (derog.)
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)

sentences.english: They run rampant with spyware and viruses.
sentences.chinese: 他们与间谍软件和病毒狼狈为奸。

sentences.english: Really there is economic brains, yet estimate also together here be one performing in collusion because malign purpose of commander.
sentences.chinese: 的确有经济头脑，但估计也同这里当官的狼狈为奸。

sentences.english: YangXiu see eldest brother became so discomfiture.
sentences.chinese: 杨秀一见大哥变得如此狼狈。

sentences.english: Accept the fluster of lost door keys.
sentences.chinese: 耐心地忍受丢失钥匙的狼狈。

sentences.english: Why did he always think of HIM when he was in discomfiture?
sentences.chinese: 何以他总是在狼狈不堪时想起那个人？

sentences.english: Her disheveled appearance when she arrives is meat for Caroline's gossip, but Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 她到达时的狼狈相，为卡罗琳说长道短提供了话柄。

sentences.english: This is my"legal"mentality intheface of society discomposure start.
sentences.chinese: 这是我以“法律”心态面对社会的狼狈开局。

sentences.english: He made an embarrassing gaffe at the convention last weekend.
sentences.chinese: 他在上周末的会议上出了洋相，狼狈不堪。

sentences.english: This idiom is used to describe doing evil things in collusion with others.
sentences.chinese: 狼狈为奸这个成语比喻坏人互相勾结起来干坏事。

sentences.english: I tried not to cry in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 我忍住眼泪，不愿在他面前露出狼狈相。

sentences.english: The enemy fled in disorder by night.

sentences.chinese: 正剃须的我那时真的很狼狈。

sentences.english: The reactionaries work hand-in-glove with the imperialists to suppress the national liberation movement.
sentences.chinese: 反动派同帝国主义狼狈为奸，镇压民族解放运动。

sentences.english: Some of the local policemen are in with the criminals.
sentences.chinese: 当地某些警察和罪犯狼狈为奸。

sentences.english: This exit appear fast and helter-skelter.
sentences.chinese: 这次的退出显得快而狼狈。

sentences.english: Bob was in a pickle when his car broke down in a pouring rainstorm.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃的汽车在倾盆大雨中熄火，使他狼狈不堪。

definition: battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
head and face filthy with grime (idiom)/covered in dirt/dejected and depressed
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
a bloody nose and a swollen face/badly battered
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
